pull.title: BIP 0009: Remove transparent background from figure.
pull.body:
Dear champion, authors, community:

A copy of the revision message follows:

> Remove transparent background from figure.
> 
> Before this change, the figure presented black text on transparent
> background, which might be unconvenient when using a browser able to
> pass a dark theme preference to some environments where this document
> is published, currently notably GitHub. A white background could help
> a better visualization compromise. White background on the figure is
> the single purpose of this revision.
> 
> This PNG was compiled using:
> 
>     dot -Tpng states.gv -o states.png

TL;DR: I have some visualization problems on dark theme, and this fixes it for me.

TS;DR: Please ask for anything requiring explanation, screenshots showing the problem, visualization changes... anything you need.

Thank you.

Cheers,

events.body: Must fixup (squash) cdeec7d23ebed4290b651fec12dd3f05b878dd63 in 6e56466e934a82435d54e9a2b5dab70827404520 before merging, if that were to be the case. Set draft.

rename.to: BIP 0009: Remove transparent background from figure.

issue.title: BIP 0002: Remove transparent background from figure
issue.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184,
but there transparent background hampers reading text much more
than here hampers seeing the node relationships.

issue.title: BIP 0174: Remove transparent background from figures
issue.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184
and https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1192. In 1192, node connections
are visible, but with low contrast. In 1184 and in this case, arrows are
barely visible at all.

issue.title: BIP 0144: Remove transparent background from figure
issue.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184,
https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1192,
and https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1193. In 1192, node connections
are visible, but with low contrast. In 1184 and in 1192 and in 1193 and in
this case, there are figure elements, arrows or texts, barely visible at all,
when GitHub is switched to dark theme.

issue.title: BIP 0156: Remove transparent background from figures.

events.message:
Remove transparent background from figure.

Before this change, the figure presented black text on transparent
background, which might be unconvenient when using a browser able to
pass a dark theme preference to some environments where this document
is published, currently notably GitHub. A white background could help
a better visualization compromise. White background on the figure is
the single purpose of this revision.

This PNG was compiled using:

    dot -Tpng states.gv -o states.png

events.body: Personally, I like the older style better...

I encourage anyone
to solve the issue alternatively
on their own
applying the same approach as in #1193

I have verified that the content of the graph is unchanged except for the new style and background color.

ACK 497ad1c81a8d7e882c86ffe780db5b01db66d686
